info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 19 at 5:56PM EDT until June 19 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN MADISON...RAPPAHANNOCK AND NORTHWESTERN CULPEPER COUNTIES... At 555 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles northwest of Culpeper, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Culpeper, Sperryville, Flint Hill, Washington, Castleton, Catalpa, Slate Mills, Viewtown, Etlan, Hackleys Crossroads, Woodville, Amissville, Jeffersonton, Five Forks, Rock Mills, Cardova, Reva, Rixeyville, Leon and Boston. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
